We are running a simulated car racing competition as part of the IEEE
Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Games. One motivation for
this competition is comparing strengths and weaknesses of various CI
techniques, such as temporal difference learning, neuroevolution, etc.
Another motivation is just having a fun competition that is as easy as
possible to participate in, but still has some depth to it.

I think NEAT could do very well on this problem, and interfacing it
(especiall one of the Java versions) to the competition code should be
quite simple. Is anyone up to the challenge? More information on the
competition is available here:

http://julian.togelius.com/cig2007competition/

Best regards
Julian
